snippet: Amid organic farms and ranches, the government is opening up thousands of acres of public land for oil and gas drilling, part of its largest lease sale in Colorado since President Obama took office.
abstract: Federal government, amid organic farms and ranches in Colorado, is opening up thousands of acres of public land for oil and gas drilling, part of its largest lease sale in state since President Obama took office; Coloradans in cities to the west support lease sale, but nearby residents say drilling threatens economy of tourism and farming.
lead_paragraph: Amid organic farms and ranches, the government is opening up thousands of acres of public land for oil and gas drilling, part of its largest lease sale in Colorado since President Obama took office.

headline.seo: Colorado Communities Take On Fight Against Energy Land Leases
headline.main: Colorado Communities Take On Fight Against Energy Land Leases
headline.print_headline: Colorado Communities Take On Fight Against Energy Land Leases
